description: Temporary addition to off-licence sales to the licence and temporary suspension of condition 351 to allow the premises to offer off sales. Condition to expire as soon as the venue is able to operate without social distancing requirements.temporary amendment to condition 291 to allow the venue to operate without the requirement for SIA, but only when offering no regulated entertainment and as a predominantly seated premises with a significantly reduced capacity below 50% of the current Fire Risk assessed capacity of 250. At any time when the venue is offering regulated entertainment or is able to operate beyond 50% capacity with vertical drinking, the current SIA requirements would be enforceable, and once social distancing measures are withdrawn the condition would be reinstated to its current wording.Two permanent changes are requested - the removal of condition 371 )-That the premises licence holder will submit Promotion Event Risk Assessment - Form 696s to Southwark Police Licensing Unit in respect of all new DJ's and new events involving recorded music at the premises), the reason being that this condition is out of date. Permanently amending condition 4AJ by removing part (d) (Whenever the outside area is operating to a maximum of 8 patrons smoking on the premises frontage, the outside awning will be extended), the reason being that the awning was damaged beyond repair by wind some time ago and will not be replaced.
